author: Galaxy12_Import
title: Comprehensive Yet a Treat for the Eyes
review:
Mr. Matthes has put together this wonderful volume that effectively collects and condenses a large and specialized corner of the LEGO universe. "The LEGO Trains Book" is not your average hobby guide, instead it embraces the very roots of what makes the LEGO Train niche a world of its own. First opening with an overview of the LEGO train lines and models through the years, then presenting MOCs and explaining variations among scales, and finally providing instructions for the presented material, Matthes has managed to produce a book that not only introduces the world of LEGO Trains but sends the reader into their own projects with a sense of full support from the LEGO Train community.    

There are of course no actual LEGO pieces included and "playability" doesn't exactly apply, but the book stands on its own as a special addition to any LEGO Train collection, no bricks required.
